sub_title: Director of Connect International - Consultant WASH - Politician promoting cash4all4life
summary:
• Policy development, assessments, research and evaluations of the organizational, institutional and sector aspects of water and sanitation in both emergency and development programs and organizations.
• Development of national drinking water and sanitation strategies/policies.
• Quantitative and qualitative research and research tools, with high beneficiary participation levels
• Institutional Development (for water, sanitation and community development).
• Production of quality systems, manuals, operational protocols, and proposals for emergency and development projects and programs in developing countries with a main focus on community development and water and sanitation.
Cash transfers in development and humanitarian aid.
• Operational management of international development organizations.
• Management of participative development, rehabilitation and emergency programs.
• Training of expatriate and local staff (emergency watsan, disaster preparedness, community and NGO development, participative approaches and programs)
• Facilitation of capacity building in local and international NGO’s.
• Development, implementation and facilitation of demand driven approaches for self help. 
• Application and training of participative methods (PRA, AI, OOPP, RRA).

publications.name: Concept paper and Model Guidelines for mainstreaming water and sanitation in emergencies, protracted crises, LRRD and disaster preparedness operations

authors.headline: Director of Connect International - Consultant WASH - Politician promoting cash4all4life

profile_positions.description:
Connect International is an international NGO and non-profit consultancy bureau with four lines of action:

1) PROJECTS focused on WASH (Water, Sanitation & Hygiene) & community development. We support, facilitate and capacity build local partners who facilitate and support poor people and local companies in developing countries to implement rural WASH projects, develop involved value chains, and develop their communities. Key words: sustainability, institutional development, Village Action Groups, micro credits, revolving funds, blended finance, quality control/monitoring.

2) CONSULTANCIES with regard to WASH in development, rehabilitation and humanitarian contexts in rural, poor urban and settlement areas from international down to beneficiary level, starting as much as possible at the beneficiary level. We collaborate with our network of high quality local consultancy partner bureaus and consultants in different countries, also assisting and training them on specific WASH expertise. We work with expatriate consultants where needed and local consultants where possible. Our focus is on WASH programs, organizations, governments, sectors, IT and finance. We work partly with own developed tools and manuals for project development, data journey development, low-cost WASH technologies, project implementation, etc.

3) TRAININGS on project development (2 modules) and data journey development (2 modules).

4) ADVOCACY regarding cash transfers for all adult people in developing countries for life (cash4all4life) and solutions for migration.

www.connectinternational.nl.
profile_positions.title: Employment - Executive Director

company.name: Landell Mills, Enclude Solutions, European Investment Bank (EIB), Aqua for All, Cordaid, QUEST-Cons

profile_positions.location: Kenya, Mozambique, Tanzania, Uganda, Afghanistan, Zimbabwe, Malawi, Congo, Somal
profile_positions.company: Landell Mills, Enclude Solutions, European Investment Bank (EIB), Aqua for All, Cordaid, QUEST-Cons
profile_positions.description:
1.      2019 (4 months). BRLi/WE Consult/AFD (French Government). Team leader. Development of sanitation, gender and environment & Social action plans for a large WASH project covering the whole of Isingiro district, Uganda.

2.	2015 – April 2018 (3 years). Landell/Enclude/EIB. WASH expert. Assisted MFI in Kenya regarding credit lines for low cost WASH among the Bottom of the Pyramid resulting in sales of water filters and other WASH solutions to MFI customers in Kisii. 

3.	2008 – 2012 (4 months). A4All, CI. Team leader. Assessment and market trials to commercially introduce household filters in Mozambique, Tanzania, Uganda, and set up value chains through distributor networks. 

4.	2005 – 2006 (2 months). Cordaid. Afghanistan. Investigating and improving the effectiveness of community social and health structures with a WASH focus, implemented by Cordaid’s partners, incl. facilitating the government to review its national community social and healthcare guidelines.
 
5.	2000 (1 month). NL Red Cross. Assessment of the rehabilitation needs in areas flooded by Cyclone Eline in Zimbabwe and Malawi and production of proposals for rehab programs in both countries. 

6.	2001 (2 months). Cordaid. Preparing emergency and rehabilitation programs, investigations in camps in Pakistan, identifying programs in Afghanistan, capa-city building of Afghan NGO’s. Subjects: watsan, food, agriculture. 

7.	1997 – ‘00 (5 months). SAWA/GTZ/Quest/OTP. Malawi, Zimbabwe, Congo, Somalia. Assessment, identification, design of (rehabilitation of) piped water systems. 

8.	1997 (1 month). QUEST-Consult. Somalia. Preparing the winning tender for evaluation of the EC Rehabilitation Program for Somalia. Including advice for changes of the ToR in accordance with PRAG procedures. 

9.	1996 (2 months). DRA. Rwanda. Development of a national policy and project proposal with Ministry Minitrape for the re-establishment of social infrastructures for sustained O&M of community watsan systems.
profile_positions.title: Consultancy experience - Program development and guidance

profile_positions.location: Tanzania, Malawi, Mozambique, Ethiopia, Eritrea, Zimbabwe, Netherlands, UK, Ireland, Palestine
profile_positions.company: Netherlands Red Cross, PSO, GFA, Kerk in Actie, Aqua for All, Winrock, IRC, RedR-UK, KdK, QUEST, MSM
profile_positions.description:
1.	2022 (1 week). In-person training of Palestinian water experts in project development with a focus on development of problem trees and Theories of Change, based on project ideas and problems identified by the participants.

2.	2021 (1 week). Digital Triple Helix training to 20 Palestinian water experts. Customer: Maastricht School of Management (MSM).

3.    2015 (1 month). Training of staff of a MFI in Kenya. in general WASH aspects with a focus on water filters, roof water catchment systems and other household WASH solutions. Several staff were also trained as trainers.

4.	2010- 2014 (3 months). PSO, CI, SHIPO, RKWO. Trained local NGOs in Tanzania and Malawi on quality assurance and online software for Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Reporting (PMER). 

5.	2013 - 2014 (2 months). GFA Swiss contact and Kerk in Actie. Mozambique. Trained local NGO (Visao da Comunidade) and others in business development of smallholder farmers irrigated crop value chains.

6.	2014 (1 month). A4All/Winrock. Training local NGO’s in Malawi in business development for water filter sales + value chain development.

7.	2002 - 2003 (3 months). NL Red Cross. Ethiopia, Eritrea, Zimbabwe. Workshops and training of branch level staff on program planning, participatory assessment methods and community development in areas struck by floods and droughts. Manuals for all concept parts.

8.	2001 (0,5 month). IRC. Netherlands. Natural disasters training for UNICEF staff on international relief system, assessment, planning and implementing emergency programs, disaster preparedness.

9.	1995 - 1998 (4 months). RedR-UK, KdK, QUEST-Consult, Red Cross. UK, Ireland, Netherlands. Watsan emergency+ disaster preparedness  trainings.

profile_positions.description:
1.	2021 (6 months). Philip Morris International (PMI) and WE Consult. Consultant. Development of water quality and water availability guidelines for PMI’s WASH program in six countries divided over three continents.

2.	2018/2019 (5 months). DANIDA and WE Consult for the Ministry of Water and Environment in Uganda. Team leader. Development of a new O&M and organizational framework for rural water infrastructure in Uganda.

3.	2017 (2 months). Consultant. UNHCR. Development of folders and Standard Operational Procedures (SOPs) in UNHCR format for cash transfer programs for refugees for sanitation, water and hygiene items. 

4.	2017 (1 month). CI. Team leader. Policy and advocacy paper for the Netherlands government on the potential of cash transfers to curb poverty structurally. 

5.	2012 – ‘13 (1,5 month). Consultant. NL + Uganda Red Cross. Uganda. Development + field testing with RC Uganda branches of a self-assessment tool (BOCA). 

6.	1996 (4 months). Consultant. Government of The Netherlands. Research document on M&E of watsan programs in camps for refugees or displaced persons.
profile_positions.title: Consultancy experience - Development of guiding documents & policies

company.name: Dutch gov., IMC, UN agencies, American Red Cross, A4All, ECHO

profile_positions.description:
Only most recent assignments:

1.	2022 (6 months). Review of the WASH interventions executed by IRW from 2017 – 2021 in all countries where IRW is active. Consultant, Customer: Islamic Relief Worldwide (IRW).

2.	2021 (4 months). Structural review of the Field Support Team (FST) of the Global WASH Cluster. Consultant. Customer: Action Against Hunger

3.	2020 (2 months). Evaluation of Akvo's D2D program funded by the Dutch Government, including whether and how the Dutch Government can finance Akvo in the future. Akvo is a software provider in the WASH sector, transforming to a WASH consultancy bureau on digitalisation and data management. Team leader. Customer: MinBUZA.

4.	2020 (2 months). Evaluation of SNV's P2P Fund for subsidized loans to small WASH businesses and households in Ghana, followed by a formulation phase to develop an improved Fund. Team leader. Customer: Embassy of the Netherlands in Ghana

5.	2019 (12 months). Evaluation of DFID funded WASH programs between 2011-2015 (200 M Euro), with a focus on targeting and sustainability, in Tanzania, Mozambique, Zambia, Malawi, Zimbabwe. Regional coordinator. Customer: IMC World. 

6.	2018/2019 (3 months). Evaluation of an emergency and development WASH program by the Indonesian Red Cross in 5 Provinces in Indonesia. Team leader. Customer: American Red Cross. 

7.	2018 (3 months). Evaluation of a flood resilience WASH program in North Ghana executed by 4 UN agencies. Team leader. Customer: UN-Habitat. 

8.	2017  (3 months). 13 WASH projects assessed in Kenya and Bangladesh. Evaluator. Customer: A4All.

9.	2014  (1,5 month). A4All. 9 WASH projects evaluated in Kenya. Evaluator.

10.	2011  (1,5 month). Assessment of urban and rural water projects and water systems in Ghana. Assessor. Customer: A4All.

11.	2005  (4 months). Review of ECHO funded WASH interventions and production of ECHO’s watsan strategy and operational guidelines. WASH expert. Customer: ECHO.
profile_positions.title: Consultancy experience - WASH program evaluations, assessments and reviews

profile_positions.description:
Only most recent assignments:

2.	2020 (2 months). Development of and guidance to a WASH baseline survey among farmers producing tobacco for Philip Morris International (PMI). Team leader. Customer: PMI.
